class_notes:
All 2nd year JD students will be auto-enrolled in Trial Techniques. This course is required for all 2L students and is a JD degree requirement.
This course is eligible to be counted towards the requirements for the J.D. concentration in Criminal Litigation.
course_description: Trial Techniques is a "learning-by-doing" course. The students will receive instruction on various trial skills and then be asked to perform those skills. The Spring sessions will focus on case analysis, direct and cross examination, impeachment, and use of exhibits at trial. The May sessions will take the students through a entire case, with a Daubert hearing mid-week and a jury trial on the final day of the program.
sections: Class Nbr: 2680, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: Does Not Meet, Instructor: M. Ginsberg, Status: Open
